jobs.jobDescription: Develop user-centric features for a credit-improvement mobile app using Flutter and TypeScript with Firebase, focusing on enhancing user experience and scalability for customers with lower credit score. Actively manage app performance monitoring and issue resolution, collaborating with cross-functional teams to optimize payment processing, rewards, and effective credit-building functionalities

Developing large-scale architecture handles millions of requests daily with Java, Sprint framework. Designing and implementing payment’s failure recovery components which run with HTTP clients, ActiveMQ message service, batch, caching, Oracle, Relational database, and UI frameworks like Vue.
Built thick UI client for tutor scheduling system which enables students to book sessions, and administrators to perform auditing using React, JavaScript, and PHP.
Developed a web client for companies’ online ads performances using React, Redux, TypeScript. Introduced to Data Science research to improve accuracy of company’s Ad selection ML model.

jobs.companyName: UW-Madison Department of Materials Science and Engineering
jobs.jobDescription: Fed alloy images to YOLOv3 network, detected the defects in the TEM videos, and tracked their number and size. Calculated the generation and annealing and achieved high accuracy defects detection with 0.95 F1 and low latency.
Developed website, prototype for solar energy dashboard, and mentored new developers.
Implemented a patient care Android app with features such as patient monitoring and patient engagement enhanced by text to speech using Java, SQL.
Supported food preparation and kitchen operations for university events and community gatherings.
Assisted students during the move-in process by helping with luggage and providing guidance for dormitory setup.
Provided tutoring services to a high school student in subjects including Math, Science, History, and English, achieving significant improvements in academic performance.
Led tutoring sessions in a variety of subjects, adapting teaching methods to individual student learning styles for exam preparation.
